uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class MouseStatus

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.MouseStatus
public class MouseStatus
extends java.lang.Object

Mouse Status is a new class designed to take some of load (and code bloat) out of the main Viewer class.
Although MouseStatus objects should only be setup and configured by Viewer objects MouseStatus objects will be usefull for objects that are to act as tools in conjunction with a Viewer as the MouseStatus should carry all of the information any tool should need to know about what and where a user has been interacting with the mouse on the viewer.
The MouseStatus class tracks mouse movements (particularly drags) in three co-ordinate systems.
Screen space
'GeoGraphic' space.
projected space.

isValidDrag

public boolean isValidDrag()
On some ocasions the user may click and hold the mouse button and move the pointer a very small distance by accident. In most cases this should not be interprited as a valid drag.

This method checks to see if the last drag distance was grater than a small threshold.

Returns:
boolean true only if the last drag was more than a small threshold value.

dragTo

protected void dragTo(int x,
                      int y)

isMouseStill

public boolean isMouseStill()
Test to see if the mouse has not moved for a while.
Useful for deciding if ToolTips or similer should be displayed.
Returns:
boolean true if the mouse has not moved for timeout milliseconds.

isDraging

public boolean isDraging()
Test to see if the user is currently performing a drag operation
Returns:
boolean true if the user has started but not finished a drag.
